Posts.Content: Dec 4, 2009 09:47AM gardengirl42 wrote: Hi all,  I just joined so all this is new to me.  I had a bilateral mx on 11/18 because of a very large tumor in the left breast and positive BRCA1.  I had a lot of time to adjust to losing both breasts since I had to do chemo first to shrink the tumor (it melted completely away).  At first, I just wanted my breasts gone so I could live.  Later, when things looked more positive for me, I began to mourn their loss and I was afraid I'd look really freakish for a long time.  Now that I'm through surgery with TEs in, I'm actually surprised how "normal" I look.  Of course, it's not like it used to be but in clothing (two expansions so far and I was always small breasted), I look normal even without a bra (given that it's winter and I'm not wearing revealing tanks).  Without clothing, both my husband and I are surprised at how quickly the suture site is healing and we can both imagine what I'll look like when it's all done.  We actually did make love for the first time last night and just agreed we wouldn't put pressure on ourselves to measure how it went.  We laughed a lot at feeling silly in awkward poses (so he didn't put too much pressure on me) and I wore a pretty lingerie top so the shape of my breasts was there but we weren't looking at the scars.  Hang in there.  You've had a lot to process in a short time.  You will find your way through (and tears are a part of the way through).  Hope you are recovering quickly, Lisa
